result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Holloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, school and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done. Collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages.  To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
$221.00 to be paid to Tsegaye G.  Joint and several with any uncharged coactors.

Mental health assessment.  Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Letter of apology to the victim.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Tsegaye G.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens. No positive results.
Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I Felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

has error

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.  

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 137 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.

The court STAYED the sentence as to both counts and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:  

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Tsegaye G.
*Letter of apology to the victim.
*Complete 30 hours of community service.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $221.00 to be paid to Tsegaye G., joint and several with any uncharged co-actors.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs, fees, restitution and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge if not already done, collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages. To be paid by the end of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.  

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Andrew M Holloway in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing.  Court is in trial.  Defendant does not have documentation he would like to provide to the Court.    Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court amends bail to $500 PRB Bond with turn over to Justice Point.  All previously set terms and conditions of bail to apply.

**JUDGE ROSA FOR JUDGE POCAN.**
Defendant Andrew M Holloway in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Andrew M Holloway in custody.  Tyrone St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum, jury instruction and offer letter received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defense motion to reduce bail argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Court amends bail to $500 PRB Bond with turn over to Justice Point.  All previously set terms and conditions of bail to apply.  Matter is adjourned for sentencing, State to comply with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

4/20/16 trial date is removed from the calendar.
